[17]What if you had an accident? Huh? What if you ran somebody over on your way out here? Lawsuit like that could bankrupt me. 
[18]You can pick up your last check on Friday. You've got two weeks benefits. 
[19]He's on two weeks leave unpaid... I'm sorry Curtis. You did this to yourself.
dialogues.DOCTOR SHANNAN:
[1]Curtis, how you doin' bud? 
[2]How's my girl? 35. 
[3]That's good to hear. Tilt your head back for me. 
[4]Oh. Did she get that down wrong? 
[5]Oh. So what's the problem? 
[6]How long's this been goin' on? 
[7]You're not sleepin' at all? 
[8]Well, I think four nights is a little too soon to tell. My advice would be to not eat or drink anything after 8 o'clock at night. Cut back on any alcoholic drinks, tobacco, caffeine...get some daily exercise. 36. 
[9]Why do you say that? 
[10]You urinated in your bed? 
[11]You been to see your mother lately? 
[12]Okay. This is a prescription for a pretty mild sedative. It's non- habit forming, but I'm only giving you enough for a few days anyway. Take it and see if it helps. In the meantime,  This is the number of a good friend of mine in Columbus. He's a psychiatrist. It's a drive, but he's the best I know. 37. 
[13]I'll give him a call and let him know you'll be down to see him.
dialogues.SARAH:
[1]Curtis. 
[2]Come in. 
[3]No. 
[4]Isn't she lovely. 
[5]Yes. 
[6]Yes. Because Kyle was going to be a senior. 
[7]Yes. 
[8]What do you mean? 
[9]Oh, I don't know. I remember it was a real stressful time. Your father was gone a lot, and I couldn't handle things on my own. 
[10]No. Nothing like that. There was always... 47. 
[11]There was always a panic that took hold of me. I thought people were watching me or listening to me. 
[12]Are you okay?
dialogues.KENDRA:
[1]Come in. 
[2]Hi. 
[3]Have a seat. I'm Kendra. 
[4]I'm gonna start by askin' you some questions. 
[5]Yeah, I know. I looked at `em, but I need to get a profile started on you. 
[6]Look. I'm a counselor. Certified, but I'm not a psychiatrist. I can't prescribe anything to you. I can talk to you, I can recommend where to send you, but that's it. 
[7]Now that said, if you want to talk, I'll listen. For a lot of people that's a good start. 
[8]Now you said here that your mother was diagnosed with paranoid schizophrenia in her thirties. And you're at 35. You wanna talk about that? 
[9]So tell me `bout these dreams.
dialogues.NAT:
[1]They were just drinkin' and laughin' and oh, my god...it was like I was bein' in a museum and I saw the progress from apes to men. I saw it. I saw the future. Dewart, that was him...that was going to be him in 20 years. 
[2]Let me tell you, you laugh. You laugh. But this little one in your arms is gonna be shufflin' in a bar just like `em. Yep... Hannah! 5. 
[3]I'll call next week about the Lions Club supper. 
[4]What like slaw? 
[5]Dewart's been tellin' me how strange Curtis has been actin' lately. I am so sorry. 
[6]It's not like you don't have enough on your plate with Hannah.
dialogues.PSYCHIATRIST:
[1]Do you have any vacation time that you could use? 
[2]Well, I know that times are hard, but I think it's really important for you to separate yourself from that storm shelter. 89. 
[3]I think you need to break away from it for awhile. We can start you on some medication that I think will help, but that action alone would mean a lot. 
[4]I think that would be okay if we start the medication now. It would give you all some time to prepare as a family, but I want to be clear, when Curtis gets back he'll need to take more time than that. 
[5]I mean that he'll need hands on therapy at a real facility. 
[6]I think you need to seriously commit to some treatment.
